structure.unit: RIOT, DISORDERLY CONDUCT, AND RELATED OFFENSES

text.section: A person is guilty of institutional vandalism when he, because of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, or national origin of another individual or group of individuals, knowingly vandalizes, defaces, damages, or desecrates objects defined in KRS 525.110.
Institutional vandalism is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 606, sec. 52, effective July 15, 1998.
